results.title: Working together
results.creator_credit: Australian Dairy Board, Lilias Castle and Norman Castle
results.brief_description: South-East Asia is rich in natural resources and food potential is good but an improvement in farming techniques is needed and high protein foods are scarce. Australia, with its highly mechanised dairy industry, can provide aid and personnel in setting up and maintaining jointly-owned factories is such countries as Indonesia, Hong Kong, Singapore, the Philippines and Japan.

results.title: Working together
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development and Chris O'Rourke
results.brief_description: Outlines ways in which parents can become actively involved in the running of their local school. Shows how at various schools throughout the state parents are helping with children’s reading, writing, mathematics, typing, school displays and review of school policy.

results.title: Working together
results.brief_description: Describes employment opportunities for handicapped people in the Great Yarmouth area. Focuses on the possibilities raised by extensive co-operation between the local Disablement Resettlement Officer, the Adult Training Centre and one enlightened employer.

results.title: Working together
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Atoms for Peace”.
Regional and international co-operation of scientists ad governments in the development of peaceful se of atomic energy; and some of the achievements of this co-operation, sch as the flow of isotopes from one country to another, the transfer of fissionable materials for research purposes, and the establishment of international centres for atomic research. From the series “Atoms for peace”.

results.title: Working to a system
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Small Business”.
Production problems in the smaller business are of two main types: getting the most from existing resources and gearing production for expansion. Both are examined and advice is given on meeting some of the special difficulties likely when mechanisation is introduced, on management controls, the use of charts for production planning and order processing.

results.title: Working on it
results.creator_credit: Film Australia and Australia. Dept. of Employment, Education and Training
results.brief_description: An extensive cross section of people relate their experiences of termination and unemployment. Participants provide ideas to assist viewers in obtaining employment including the role of the CES, regularly scanning newspapers, networking with colleagues/mates and especially emphasising the importance of word-of-mouth. Addresses depression vs. motivation, preparation of an up-to-date resume, the importance of pre-interview research and interview tips, particularly selling yourself. Stresses not to give up despite the discouragement of rejection and maintain confidence by adopting a positive and open attitude towards re-education or career direction changes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Film Australia and Australia. Dept. of Employment, Education and Training

results.title: Working in a store
results.creator_credit: Basic Films, Sir Arthur Hallam Elton and Kay Mander
results.brief_description: The second film in the series “Is this the job for me?” shows what it is like to work in a stores as seen through the eyes of a young girl who has just left school. It gives an unvarnished account of the life of a salesgirl; points out the advantages and disadvantages of this type of work and describes the opportunities for advancement.

results.title: Working girls
results.creator_credit: Lizzie Borden, Alternate Current and Andy Gladstone
results.brief_description: A documentary style feature film set in a brothel in Manhattan. Centring on a prostitute named Molly, the film takes us from her private life to the everyday routines of the brothel and exposes the working conditions and conflicts that confront the prostitutes. An open and unglamorous account of the women who work in the brothel.
